thread.title: Reports: South Carolina's Steve Spurrier retiring
thread.title_full: Reports: South Carolina's Steve Spurrier retiring

author: Fletcher Page
title: Reports: South Carolina's Steve Spurrier retiring
text:
Video: UGA OL Greg Pyke: 'we're right there' 
The Ole Ball Coach may be calling it a career. 
Steve Spurrier told his South Carolina players and assistants Monday night he is retiring effective immediately, according to reports by multiple outlets. 
The news was first reported by SI.com and also by ESPN. 
Spurrier, 70, has been asked numerous times in the recent past about when heâ€™ll end his coaching career. 
An interim coach will be named Wednesday, according to ESPN. 
Spurrier is 228-89-2 in 27 seasons as a college coach, including guiding Florida to the 1996 national championship. 
He won 86 games after taking over South Carolina in 2005, but the Gamecocks are 2-4 this season and 3-9 in their last 12 Southeastern Conference games.
